title: Fix mobile horizontal overflow and right-side black space on WishMint AI

requirements.text: Update the site viewport configuration by replacing the existing viewport meta tag in `frontend/index.html` with exactly: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, viewport-fit=cover" />`.

quotes:
Add viewport meta tag:

```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, viewport-fit=cover" />
```

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` contains the viewport meta tag exactly as provided by the user.
The previous `initial-scale=1.0` viewport meta tag is removed/replaced (no duplicate viewport tags).

requirements.text: Add a global, mobile-safe overflow prevention baseline in `frontend/src/index.css` to fully eliminate horizontal scrolling: apply `width: 100%`, `margin: 0`, and `overflow-x: hidden` to `html, body`, and ensure `#root` is `width: 100%` with `min-height: 100vh`.
acceptanceCriteria: At mobile widths (360px / 390px / 414px), the page does not allow horizontal scrolling (no sideways pan).
#root expands full width and at least the viewport height on mobile.

requirements.text: Ensure the premium dark gradient background covers the full screen width/height on mobile by applying the background to either `body` or a single full-width top-level wrapper (e.g., the `App` root) using `width: 100vw` (or `w-full`) and `min-height: 100vh`, without introducing horizontal overflow.

quotes:
Make sure background gradient covers full screen:

Apply background to:

* body
  OR
* full-width wrapper using width: 100vw and min-height: 100vh

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, there is no unstyled/black empty band on the right side; the background visually covers the entire viewport.
No new horizontal overflow is introduced by `100vw` usage (if used, it is handled safely).
The existing dark premium gradient design language remains consistent (no visual theme change away from the current dark/neon look).

requirements.text: Audit and fix layout containers and section components to remove any non-responsive fixed width constraints that can force overflow (e.g., `w-[400px]`, `w-[420px]`, `w-[450px]`, or problematic `max-w-[500px]`). Replace them with mobile-first responsive patterns (`w-full`, optional `max-w-[480px]`, `mx-auto`, and `px-4` / `p-4` / `p-6`) so content stretches correctly on small screens.

quotes:
Remove any fixed width layouts like:

* width: 420px
* w-[400px]
* w-[450px]
* max-w-[500px] if breaking layout

Replace them with responsive structure:

* width: 100%
* max-width: 480px (optional)
* margin: 0 auto
* padding: 16px

acceptanceCriteria: No fixed-width Tailwind classes (e.g., `w-[400px]`, `w-[420px]`, `w-[450px]`) remain on main layout wrappers/sections that participate in the mobile layout flow.
Primary sections (Hero, Generator, Templates, Pricing, Outputs, etc.) render with full-width behavior on 360px/390px/414px without clipping or right-side empty space.

requirements.text: Identify and eliminate the specific DOM element(s) causing right-side overflow (e.g., oversized absolutely positioned layers, transforms, fixed alignment, or any element wider than 100%). Adjust the offending styles/classes so no element exceeds the viewport width on mobile while keeping existing UI behavior intact.

quotes:
Ensure no element is causing overflow:

* Remove large absolute positioned elements
* Remove fixed left alignment
* Check for elements wider than 100%

acceptanceCriteria: At 360px/390px/414px, the page fully fits the screen with NO black area on the right side.
There is no horizontal scrollbar and no content is cut off on the left/right edges.
Existing interactions and feature behavior are unchanged (only layout/overflow fixes).

constraints: Do not edit files under the immutable frontend paths: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Maintain the current dark premium gradient + neon (purple/green) design; do not re-theme the app.
All user-facing text related to this fix (if any) must remain in English.
nonGoals: Do not add new product features, sections, or authentication changes as part of this task.
Do not change backend Motoko code or data models for this layout fix.
Do not modify the Google Analytics snippet beyond the requested viewport meta tag change.
